p: Human clinical research of NSAIDs in RSV is sparse. A large retrospective study using propensity scores to simulate an RCT of ibuprofen and acetaminophen in human bronchiolitis found that both drugs decreased wheezing at 12 months follow-up.[ 30] However, the authors were unable to assess duration of symptoms prior to NSAID prescription and they could not distinguish RSV from non-RSV bronchiolitis.[ 30] Despite the very different design and associated limitations this work complements ours and helps draw the outlines for future large studies in human infants.
